The  hitmerge7  program  uses  the [wiki:HirlamHowto/Man/nukem nukem] library to read the input file.

{{{
NAME
       hitmerge7 - ATOVS file conversion tool.

SYNTAX
       hitmerge7.x < hitmerge7.in

AVAILABILITY
       The program source code is in hirlam/mainsrc/hitmerge7.F

DESCRIPTION
       The  hitmerge7 program reads GRIB, BUFR, ascii and 2a files and can
        create BUFR, ascii, 2a and "tmp.raw" files etc.

       Headers
       The  hitmerge7  program  uses  the NUKE subroutine to read the input file.
       Enter the command 'x' (or '?') in the input file to see the list of valid headers.
       The following headers will be accepted :

 HITMERGE V1.0 [0]VFMLR
   data body -  none.  Optional.

 One of the following:
    INPUT SATELLITE OBSERVATION DATA FILE (LEVEL 1D, HIRS+MSU) [1]VFLR &1%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of input ATOVS level 1D AAPP HIRS/MSU file.

    INPUT SATELLITE OBSERVATION DATA FILE (LEVEL 1C, AMSU-A) [1]VFLR &1%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of input ATOVS level 1C AAPP AMSU-A file.
}}}
'''The previous header has been disabled. Use the perl script read_1c.pl to convert l1C to ASCII, and use the associated header below to read the ASCII file.'''
{{{
    INPUT MERGED HIRLAM, SATELLITE DATA FILE (LEVEL 2A) [1]VFLR &1%1 %2&1&1$
      data body - 1 line. Name of input 2a collocation (ATOVS and model field) file.

    INPUT BUFR FILE [1]VFLR &1%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of input ATOVS BUFR file.
}}}
'''If you have an EARS BUFR file you can not use the previous header. You must then first convert the BUFR file to L1C using AAPP tool aapp_decodebufr_1c.ksh and then convert the L1C file to ASCII using read_1c.pl and use the associated header below to read the ASCII file.'''
{{{
   INPUT SATELLITE OBSERVATION DATA FILE (ASCII) [1]VFLR &1%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of input ATOVS ASCII file.

 INPUT HIRLAM GRIB FILE [*]VFLR %2&1&1$ %3&1
   data body - many lines. Name of input model field GRIB files.

One of the following:

     OUTPUT MERGED HIRLAM, SATELLITE DATA FILE (LEVEL 2A) [1]VFLR &5%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of output 2a collocation file.

    OUTPUT BUFR FILE [1]VFLR &5%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of output BUFR file.

    OUTPUT SATELLITE OBSERVATION DATA FILE (ASCII) [1]VFLR &5%1
      data body - 1 line. Name of output ASCII file.

 OUTPUT EMISSIVITY FILE [1]VFLR &5$
   data body - 1 line. Name of output EMISSIVITY file. This file contains
   emissivities to the observations in the observation output file (e.g. BUFR).
   The emissivities are calculated from the SAF GRIB files containing
   ice-type and concentration. Optional.

 BIAS CORRECTION OUTPUT DIRECTORY [1]VFMLR %2&1$
   data body - 1 line. Name of BIAS correction database directory.
   The BIAS correction database is used to calculate the BCCF files. Optional.

 MIN, MAX ACCEPTED OBSERVED BRIGHTNESS TEMPERATURE [1]VFMLR
   data body - 1 line. Maximium and minimum limits (space-seperated) for accepted
   brightness temperatures. Optional.
 
 DO NOT IGNORE DUPLICATE FIELD ENTRIES [0]VFMLR %3&1$
   data body - none. Flag for ignoring duplicated field entries in GRIB files. Optional.

 DO NOT PUT BACKGROUND INFORMATION IN OUTPUT FILE [0]VFLR %2&1$
   data body - none. Flag for not putting model information in the 2a collocation 
    files. Optional

 DUMP DATA TO SCREEN [0]VFMLR
   data body - none. Flag for writing detailed information to screen. Optional.
}}}
